00010 package ScheatorController;
00011 
00012 import ScheatorModel.AbstractModel;
00013 import ScheatorView.*;
00014 import java.util.EventListener;
00015 import java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent;
00016 import java.beans.PropertyChangeListener;
00017 import java.lang.reflect.Method;
00018 import java.util.ArrayList;
00019 
00027 public abstract class AbstractController implements EventListener {
00028 
00029     //  Vectors that hold a list of the registered models and views for this controller.
00030 
00031     private ArrayList<AbstractViewPanel> registeredViews;
00032     private MainView mainFrame;
00033     private ArrayList<AbstractModel> registeredModels;
00034 
00035 
00037     public AbstractController() {
00038         registeredViews = new ArrayList<AbstractViewPanel>();
00039         registeredModels = new ArrayList<AbstractModel>();
00040     }
00041 
00042 
00050     public void addModel(AbstractModel model) {
00051         registeredModels.add(model);
00052         //model.addEventListener(this);
00053     }
00054 
00059     public void removeModel(AbstractModel model) {
00060         registeredModels.remove(model);
00061         //model.removePropertyChangeListener(this);
00062     }
00063 
00064 
00070     public void addView(AbstractViewPanel view) {
00071         registeredViews.add(view);
00072     }
00073 
00078     public void removeView(AbstractViewPanel view) {
00079         registeredViews.remove(view);
00080     }
00081 
00082     public void addMainFrame(MainView frame) {
00083         this.mainFrame = frame;
00084     }
00085 
00086     //  Used to observe property changes from registered models and propogate
00087     //  them on to all the views.
00088 
00094     public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt) {
00095 
00096         for (AbstractViewPanel view: registeredViews) {
00097             view.modelPropertyChange(evt);
00098         }
00099         mainFrame.modelPropertyChange(evt);
00100     }
00101 
00102 
00112     protected void setModelProperty(String propertyName, Object newValue) {
00113 
00114         for (AbstractModel model: registeredModels) {
00115             try {
00116 
00117                 Method method = model.getClass().
00118                     getMethod("set"+propertyName, new Class[] {
00119                                                       newValue.getClass()
00120                                                   }
00121                              );
00122                 method.invoke(model, newValue);
00123 
00124             } catch (Exception ex) {
00125                 //  Handle exception
00126             }
00127         }
00128     }
00129 
00130 
00131 }
